metadata.title: CVE-2018-18074 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Requests package before 2.20.0 for Python sends an HTTP Authorizationheader to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-httpredirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discovercredentials by sniffing the network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-requests - 2.9.1-3ubuntu0.1
python3-requests - 2.9.1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: requests package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1-3ubuntu0.1').
python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
